results.title: L'auberge de la Mer Tranquille = the Inn of the Quiet Mother
results.brief_description:
Annette and Vidocq are enjoying a moment of rest at the Inn of the Quiet Mother. But their peace is disrupted by the arrival of a chain gang. The captain of the chain is Vidocq’s old ennemy, capitaine Thierry. Things take a turn for the worse when a convict recognises Vidocq.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Alric, Sacha Briquet, Marcel Charvet, Alain Janey, Dominique Zardi.

results.title: Les Olympiens = the Olympians
results.brief_description:
Vidocq has joined a pirate ship transporting 300 barrels of stolen rum. A wounded soldier gives Vidocq his ID papers and our man leaps at the chance to come back to France and reunite with Annette. Shortly after his arrival at the army barracks, Vidocq receives a mysterious invitation to attend a secret meeting of The Olympians Society.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Michel Charrel, Albert Dagnant, Maurice Garrel, Fred Personne.

results.title: La Baraque Aux 36 Etoiles = the 36 Stars Fair Booth
results.brief_description:
Annette finally reaches the town of Mezieres and finds a job in a travelling circus. She is preparing an escape plan for Vidocq. The plan involves seducing the prison governor who has installed what he thinks is a failsafe alarm system in the prison: a bell that can be actionned from the corridor.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Bruno Balp, Camiret, Germaine Delbat, Pierre Tornade.

results.title: L'armee Roulante = the Rolling Army
results.brief_description:
Vidocq, Annette and friend are travelling with brand new IDs. What they don’t know is that the man who sold the papers to them works for Flambart and that their new identities belong to two army deserters.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Alric, Jacques Aveline, Jaxques Rispal, Martin Trevieres.

results.title: Le Crime de la Mule Noire = the Crime at the Black Mule Inn
results.brief_description:
Following his escape from the Bicetre prison, Vidocq arrives in a small village where a crime has just been committed. Vidocq is mistaken for Inspector Flambard and decides to test his police skills by investigating what really happened at the Black Mule Inn.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Bruno Balp, Jacqueline Danno.

results.title: Vidocq a Bicetre = Vidocq in Bicetre Prison
results.brief_description:
Vidocq is doing an other stint in prison, just time enough to organise his next escape via the asylum section. While Annette waits anxiously with a carriage outside the prison, Vidocq and friend are held captive by the lunatics. Convinced the two intruders are demons, the asylum patients decide to put the men on trial.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Helene Dieudonne, Serge Gainsbourg.

results.title: Vidocq et les Faux Temoins = Vidocq and the False Witnesses
results.brief_description:
Vidocq is attempting to locate, Grouard, part antique dealer, part fence, who got him convicted a few years earlier thanks to a false testimony.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Gabriel Gobin, Fernand Berset.

results.title: La Bijouterie Jacquelin = Jacquelin Jeweller
results.brief_description:
Vicdocq is back in Paris, with poor old Flambart forever on his trail. After a close encounter with the police, Vidocq seeks refuge in a jewellery shop which happens to belong to Jacquelin, an old army pal. Jacquelin immediately hires Vidocq to work in the shop where his past experiences as a convict proves useful to fend off swindlers of all kind. Vidocq also becomes quite taken by Jacquelin’s upstairs neighbour, Annette.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Leonce Corne, Jacques Bodoin.

results.title: L'eternel Evade = the Elusive Prisoner
results.brief_description:
Inspector Flambart is escorting a chain of convicts taking Vidocq back to the prison for the fourth time. Vidocq and his two accomplices manage to break away from the chain gang. Flambart immediadelity launches the chase to re-capture them, but Vidocq has found a safe haven with a most welcoming milkmaid.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Seiler, Mario David.

results.title: Les Hommes et la Mer (Ep.7)
results.brief_description:
A wide ranging episode covering the expansion of commercial (over) fishing of seals, whales, cod fish as well as other issues pertaining to marine protection: oil pollution, environmental activism (Greenpeace). Other issues include: survival at sea (Dr. Bombard) and yacht racing (eric Tabarly, Chichester, A. Colas, A. Gerbaud).

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.
